channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: North Korea blows up office used for talks with South
item.description: North Korea has blown up a joint liaison office used for talks between itself and South Korea, authorities in Seoul confirmed Tuesday, the latest sign that the relationship between the two longtime adversaries is rapidly deteriorating.

item.title: Trump's wish for an end to the pandemic contradicts reality
item.description: President Donald Trump has no intention of accepting any new normal dictated by the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: 'Ridiculous logic': Anderson Cooper reacts to Trump's virus remark
item.description: CNN's Anderson Cooper calls out President Trump over comments he made about coronavirus testing.

item.title: Beijing extends residential lockdowns as coronavirus infections spread
item.description: Authorities in Beijing locked down more residential compounds, had more than 30,000 restaurants disinfected and tightened outbound travel as the Chinese capital's latest coronavirus outbreak continued to spread Tuesday, with more than 100 people now infected.

item.title: At least 1 shot at Albuquerque protest. Police detain armed civilian group members
Three Indian soldiers killed in 'violent face-off' with Chinese troops
item.description: Three Indian soldiers were killed during a "violent face-off" with Chinese troops along the countries' de facto border in the Himalayas late Monday, the Indian army said in a statement.

item.title: A gang tried to kidnap one of China's richest people. It didn't end well for them
item.description: A home appliance billionaire and one of China's richest people was held hostage with his family for hours in a kidnapping attempt that was reportedly foiled when his son swam across a river to alert police, local media and authorities said.

item.title: Members of chief's SWAT team resigned after she took a knee. Watch her response
item.description: Hallandale Beach Police Chief Sonia Quiñones, who took a knee with protesters, responds to the 10 SWAT members who resigned from their unit, saying they felt unsafely restrained by politics.

item.title: Asylum seekers transferred to small Irish town started testing positive for Covid-19
item.description: Misha was living in a hotel in a leafy suburb of Ireland's capital city under the country's controversial asylum seeker accommodation system when a letter arrived.

item.title: 19-year-old Black Lives Matter activist found dead a week after she went missing
item.description: A 19-year-old Black Lives Matter activist from Florida has been found dead one week after she went missing.

item.title: NYPD officers hospitalized after drinking Shake Shack milkshakes tainted with bleach
item.description: Three New York City Police Department officers have been released from the hospital after getting sick when they drank milkshakes from Shake Shack Monday night.

item.title: Video shows police officers shoving a black protester to the ground
item.description: A video of peaceful protests in East Meadow, New York, shows Nassau County police officers shoving Terrel Tuosto to the ground and arresting him.

item.title: There could be 36 communicating intelligent civilizations in our galaxy, study says
item.description: Scientists have calculated that there could be a minimum of 36 active, communicating intelligent civilizations in our Milky Way galaxy, according to a new study.

item.title: New Zealand reports first new Covid-19 case in over three weeks - and it came from UK
Why the Donald Trump-West Point ramp story actually matters
Duterte's war on the press could provide a model for Hong Kong and beyond
item.description: Shortly after his election in 2016, Philippines President Rodrigo Duterte was asked about the murder of a crime reporter in Manila. His answer shocked a press corp that was already used to bizarre outbursts from the country's new leader.

item.title: Videos from police, the store and witnesses help piece together Rayshard Brooks' last moments alive
Former eBay employees allegedly used cockroaches, spiders, and a gruesome mask to harass a couple
item.description: Six former eBay employees face charges for cyberstalking and tampering with evidence after, according to federal prosecutors, they harassed a Boston-area couple who ran a news site that was at times critical of the company.

item.title: This Chinese tech giant is building a Monaco-sized 'city of the future'
item.description: Technology giant Tencent has unveiled plans for an almost entirely car-free "city of the future," equivalent in size to Monaco, in the Chinese metropolis of Shenzhen.

item.title: CNN goes inside Seattle's autonomous zone amid protests
item.description: CNN's Dan Simon goes inside the six-block area of Seattle where protesters have set up a so-called autonomous zone.

item.title: Pakistan releases Indian embassy staff detained over alleged hit-and-run incident
item.description: Two employees at India's embassy to Pakistan have been released after they were detained in relation to an alleged hit-and-run incident in the capital Islamabad.

item.title: FDA revokes authorization of drug Trump touted for Covid-19
item.description: The Food and Drug Administration has revoked its emergency use authorization for the drugs hydroxychloroquine and chloroquine for the treatment of Covid-19.

item.title: CNN anchor on Fox News: You can't just quote Trump lying
item.description: CNN's Brian Stelter compares the differences between what's happening on the ground in Seattle and how it's being covered by Fox News.

item.title: Black man found hanging from a tree in Los Angeles County
item.description: Robert L. Fuller, a 24-year-old black man, was found hanging from a tree in northern Los Angeles County. Fire department personnel who responded to the scene determined he was dead, the Los Angeles County Sheriff's Department said in a statement.

item.title: What it's like to fly on Europe's biggest airline right now
item.description: European travelers have begun returning to the air as border restrictions ease, but the experience of a flight on the continent's biggest airline reveals just what's in store for those willing to fly in the wake of the pandemic.

item.title: Tesla says Model S is the first EV to get 400 miles on a single charge
item.description: Tesla says its Model S Long Range Plus is the first electric vehicle to achieve over 400 miles of EPA-rated range.

item.title: Manuel Neuer reveals what it's like to play in football's 'ghost games'
item.description: If he's always had a knack of expanding his frame to make his goal seem smaller than it really is, Bayern Munich goalkeeper Manuel Neuer is all too aware of how his world has shrunk over the last few months.

item.title: 'SNL' alum shares surveillance footage of police kneeling on his neck
item.description: Comedian Jay Pharoah shared surveillance footage of him being detained by Los Angeles police, who allegedly approached him with guns drawn and knelt on his neck in a similar way that led to George Floyd's death.

item.title: $191,000 in gold bars left on a train
item.description: Swiss police are looking for a forgetful individual who left something rather important on a train -- a package full of gold bars, worth more than $190,000.

item.title: Mom and children hike hundreds of miles to escape lockdown
item.description: Impoverished by the coronavirus pandemic, Maria and her three daughters - like hundreds of thousands of other Peruvians - were forced to hike hundreds of miles back to their hometown after leaving Peru's capital, Lima.

item.title: Asian markets rally as volatile week continues
item.description: The market volatility is continuing into Asia.

item.title: US Air Force pilot dead after F-15 fighter jet crashes
item.description: A US F-15 fighter jet crashed in the North Sea off England on Monday and the condition of its pilot is unknown, according to a statement from the 48th Fighter Wing.

item.title: See this high school's creative solution to a socially distant graduation
item.description: Kennett High School in North Conway, New Hampshire, got a little creative this year for its graduation ceremony by holding the procession on chairlifts at a local ski area.

item.title: Swiss women stage scream-in for equality and an end to domestic violence
item.description: Women across Switzerland took to the streets Sunday, screaming together for one minute as part of protests for gender equality.

item.title: Several Dallas Cowboys and Houston Texans players test positive for coronavirus
item.description: Several players for the Dallas Cowboys and Houston Texans have tested positive for the coronavirus, sources tell NFL Network's Ian Rapoport and Tom Pelissero.

item.title: Oscars delayed for first time in 40 years
item.description: Film's biggest night is being rescheduled for the first time in 40 years due to the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Spike Lee apologizes after appearing to defend Woody Allen
item.description: Spike Lee used Woody Allen to make a point about "cancel culture" and has now apologized following backlash over his remarks.

item.title: NFL commissioner encourages teams to sign Colin Kaepernick
item.description: NFL commissioner Roger Goodell told ESPN Monday that he would support and encourage a team interested in signing Colin Kaepernick.

item.title: 'The call that shattered my life,' popular Nigerian pastor mourns as wife dies suddenly at 39
item.description: A former beauty queen and wife of a popular Nigerian preacher has died prompting shock and sadness in the country.

item.title: Solar Orbiter makes its first close pass of the sun
item.description: The European Space Agency's Solar Orbiter made its first close pass of the sun on Monday, getting as close as 77 million kilometers (48 million miles) from the sun's surface.

item.title: SpongeBob Squarepants gay? Nickelodeon just reinforced that theory
item.description: There has long been debate about the sexuality of SpongeBob Squarepants and some are taking a Nickelodeon tweet as his coming out.

item.title: Amy Grant shares pictures of her heart surgery scar and talks about her 'miraculous' recovery
item.description: Gospel singer-songwriter Amy Grant has shared photos of her battle scar following her "miraculous" recovery from unexpected open heart surgery.

item.title: Beyoncé demands justice for Breonna Taylor
item.description: Music icon Beyoncé called on Kentucky's attorney general to bring about justice for Breonna Taylor and ultimately "demonstrate the value of a Black woman's life." HLN's Melissa Knowles reports.

item.title: Fury vs. Joshua concern: 'Organized crime figure' involved in securing showdown
item.description: The announcement of a potential world heavyweight bout between Tyson Fury and Anthony Joshua has raised questions about the role of Irishman Daniel Kinahan in helping secure the boxing deal.

item.title: Try this total-body summer workout inspired by the playground
item.description: Whether you're a child or an adult who's young at heart, there are some workout moves the whole family can do to recapture that spontaneous feeling of being at the park, even if your state is still under partial stay-at-home orders.

item.title: A father's guide to raising good men
item.description: Aaron Gouveia, author of "Raising Boys to Be Good Men," offers parenting tips to help raise happy sons in a world filled with toxic masculinity.

item.title: See smoke rise from blown up liaison office
item.description: North Korea blew up a joint liaison office used for talks with South Korea, the latest sign of deteriorating relations between the two longtime adversaries.

item.title: North Korea isn't talking to the South anymore. Experts say it could be trying to manufacture a crisis
item.description: North Korea has shut off all lines of communication with "enemy" South Korea -- a likely signal that Pyongyang is adopting a more confrontational stance towards Seoul after more than two years of detente and failed peace talks.

item.title: What Kim Yo Jong's rise to the top says -- and doesn't say -- about being a woman in North Korea
item.description: About 20 years ago, while traveling across Russia in his forest-green armored train, Kim Jong Il is reported to have made something of a confession to a foreign emissary.

item.title: North Korea might be making millions -- and breaking sanctions -- selling sand. Yes, sand.
item.description: It was May of last year when Lucas Kuo and Lauren Sung noticed something strange: more than 100 ships gathering in the waters near Haeju, North Korea.
